learningIntentions.text: Describe the structure of the Earth in terms of core, mantle, crust and lithosphere.
Relate the formation of a range of landforms to physical and chemical weathering, erosion and deposition.
Outline the origins of and relationships between sedimentary, igneous and metamorphic rocks.
Identify that sedimentary, igneous and metamorphic rocks contain minerals.
Classify a variety of common rocks and minerals into groups according to their observable properties
Describe the conditions under which fossils form.
Outline how geological history can be interpreted in a sequence, in which the oldest sedimentary layers are at the base and the youngest layers are at the top.
Describe examples of how people from different science occupations use their understanding and skills in the exploration, mining or processing of minerals in Australia.
